overview: The Reflected Presence video work was a part of a site-specific installation in Maison Descartes, questioning power dynamics through spatial contexts of our built environments. A corner of a room is to be observed allowing spectators to catch the differences in the perception on the same corner before and after a female character is appearing.  It feels like reflecting never ends, I absorb and reflect. One day I absorb, the next I reflect. And then, I meet you and I reflect on my yesterdayâ€™s absorption and now you absorb. It is the time to reflect on what I have been absorbing. Absorbing patriarchy.  It was an empty corner just a second ago and the walls were just walls.
title: The Reflected Presence
